data.title: Juneteenth Houston
data.text:
Join the Houston Ebony Music Society for our annual Juneteenth concert, "Our Freedom Wasn‚Äôt Free: A Juneteenth Concert of Tribute ‚Äì The Tribulation, and The Triumph." The event is scheduled for June 23, 2024, at 4:00 PM at the historic Antioch Missionary Baptist Church, located at 500 Clay Street, Houston. The concert will showcase the HEOG chorus and soloists, under the direction of Dr. Oby and featuring Dr. Vicki A. Seldon as the pianist. The concert is structured in three parts: "Prelude to Freedom," "The Dream of Freedom," and "The Fight for Freedom," featuring Negro Spirituals, Civil War Folk Songs, and more. A special feature will be the performance of "Abraham Lincoln Walks at Midnight" by African American composer Florence Price, with a piano/vocal score specially prepared for this event. Dr. Oby expressed, "It will be a joy to revive this rare piece."

Dr. Jason Oby, Artistic Director of HEOG, remarked, "This year's HEOG Juneteenth concert is set to be extraordinary, reflecting on the profound sacrifices of our ancestors for our freedom."

The concert is complimentary, with validated parking available in the adjacent garage.

Established in 1984, HEOG is a performing arts organization of classically trained vocalists from Houston's African American community, dedicated to broadening the reach of opera, traditional Negro Spirituals, and classical music.

We invite families and friends to join us in the Lakes of Savannah Community as we celebrate our 4th Annual Juneteenth Celebration event.

As we look to celebrate in collaboration with understanding the over all significance of the 159 years of celebrating Juneteenth as a country, we want to invite you and your family to come celebrate with our community on June 21, 22 and 23.

Please see the details attached to the flyer, as well check out our vending opportunities and more. See you soon! Friday, 6/21 Family Movie Night; Saturday 6/22 Community Vendor Market; Fireworks Show After Dark 6/23 North VS South Kickball Tournament.

Vendor inquiry email losjuneteenth@gmail.com all and all donation please sent to paypal.me/losjuneteenth cash app $losjuneteenth. Celebrating 159 years! Celebrating the 4th annual Lakes of Savannah Juneteenth Celebration. Come support our community in the Jubilee Celebration!!

Fourth Industrial Pictures and local Writer/Director Holly Charles-Pearson, M.A. announces the Houston screening of provocative alternate history short film If They Took Us Back on Saturday, June 22, 2024 at Emancipation Park Conservancy - Cultural Center (3018 Emancipation Ave, Houston).

If They Took Us Back is inspired by a hypothetical exodus of formerly enslaved people back to Africa following the Emancipation Proclamation of 1863. More than a century later, a descendant of the ‚ÄòBlack Returns‚Äô decides to break the 160-year exile and return to the U.S. in exchange for overdue reparations from a remorseful, sympathetic and Black-obsessed America.

Majic 102.1 radio personality Madd Hatta will emcee the immersive, Juneteenth-inspired event which includes not just the screening of If They Took Us Back, but the mini-documentaryThe Making of If They Took Us Back, live musical performances from featured soundtrack artist Daniel Fears, live vendors and art exhibits, panel discussions and Q&As with the film cast and writer/director. The event is hosted by the National Black MBA Association Houston Chapter.

Audiences may choose between two screening times:

Sat, June 22 - 3pm

Sat, June 22 - 7pm

Annual Juneteenth Music Celebration

Lets celebrate freedom! It‚Äôs almost time for Houston‚Äôs most exciting Juneteenth Celebration! Mark your calendars for another unforgettable Juneteenth Celebration, filled with joy, unity, and cultural pride!

We start the morning off with the 2nd Annual Freedom Walk/Run. Lace up your sneakers or walking shoes and join us at The Emancipation Park at 7am. You won‚Äôt want to miss this short but empowering power walk that will have you feeling the spirit of freedom. We‚Äôll wrap up by 11am, and prepare to enjoy the rest of the day‚Äôs festivities!

This year‚Äôs concert lineup has a little something for everyone. The concert kicks off at 4:00 pm with the Juneteenth Community Gospel Choir followed by Southern Soul artist Roi Anderson and we will close things out with some Zydeco from Lil Nathan and the BigTimers. As always, it‚Äôs going to be a night of, good music, good food, good people and great vibes!

The concert is free, so just come on out! The crowd typically starts to gather at 3:00 pm, so grab your family and friends, and come early to secure the best spot. You‚Äôll also have the chance to explore a variety of vendors offering unique crafts, merchandise, and delectable treats from a variety of fantastic food trucks.

Remember, for everyone‚Äôs safety, we kindly ask that you leave coolers, alcohol, firearms, and large umbrellas at home. This way, we can ensure a fun and secure environment for all attendees.

Don‚Äôt miss out on this incredible Juneteenth Celebration! Join us on June 15th at Emancipation Park, where history and culture come alive. Together, let‚Äôs honor our past, celebrate our present, and pave the way for a brighter future. We look forward to seeing you at Emancipation Park!

BLACK HOUSTON BUS TOUR

SATURDAY, JUNE 15 | 10AM

Join Juneteenth Houston as we tour the historic African American communities in and around Houston! This tour is made possible by the generous support of Commissioner Rodney Ellis and Harris County Precinct 1.

There is no cost, but registration is required. To reserve your seat, visit <<https://www.juneteenthhouston.org/black-houston-bus-tour>>. Seating is limited; register today!

THINGS TO CONSIDER:

ATTIRE: There will be a lot of walking over the course of the tour. Please wear light breathable fabrics and comfortable, supportive shoes.

PROTECTION: Don‚Äôt forget your sunscreen, visors, umbrellas or whatever you need to shield yourself from the heat and prevent sunburn.

HYDRATION: There will be a limited supply of water on the bus, but we encourage participants to bring their own water or sports drinks with you. It is also advisable to begin increasing water intake a few days in advance of the tour to prevent dehydration.

WHERE TO MEET:

Buses will depart from and return to the African American History Research Center (Gregory School), 1300 Victor St. Houston, 77019.

PARKING: There are limited spots available in AAHRC‚Äôs lot and on the surrounding streets (free). There are also valet and garage options ($) on and near Gray St. We encourage ride sharing and carpooling where possible.

QUESTIONS? Contact Erika Thompson at 832-393-1526 or erika.thompson@houstontx.gov

Join us on Saturday, June 15th, for an exhilarating day of fitness, community, and fun at the second annual Freedom Walk/Run! After the huge success of our inaugural event with over 200 participants, we‚Äôre back and aiming for an even bigger turnout this year.

Date: Saturday, June 15th üïí Time: 7am üìç Location: Emancipation Park ‚Äì 3018 Emancipation HTX 77004

Your participation makes a meaningful impact on your health and a positive impact on the community. Proceeds from the event go towards fueling park programming initiatives that have a positive impact all year round. From our quarterly ‚ÄúFitness Fun Day‚Äù events to our weekly Hip-Hop aerobics, and Line dancing classes ‚Äì your steps help us keep the community moving forward in a positive direction. Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned runner, a casual walker, or just looking for a reason to enjoy the park, we‚Äôve got you covered. All fitness levels are more than welcome to join in on the fun.

Registration is free. Corporate and team registrations are open ‚Äì gather your colleagues, friends, or family members and make this an unforgettable day together.

Mark your calendars, spread the word, and let‚Äôs make this year‚Äôs Freedom Walk/Run an event to remember! Together, we stride towards healthier communities and happier lives.

We look forward to seeing you here at Emancipation Park!

Juneteenth Hall of Fame Awards is dedicated to honoring exceptional individuals and Millennials who have tirelessly worked to create economic freedom for the community! Celebrate trailblazers and give back: **each ticket provides a laptop to an underserved child**

Event Details:

Date: June 14, 2024

Time: 7:00 PM - 10:00 PM

Venue: 6309 Guhn Rd Building B, Houston, TX 77040

Dress Code: Black Tie

This annual Gala is more than just a celebration; it is a recognition of the groundbreaking contributions made by leaders and entrepreneurs who have transcended traditional boundaries. Their efforts have not only transformed our mindset but also paved the way for improved mental health, wealth, and overall well-being in the Black community.

VIP Treatment for All Attendees. Each attendee will be treated like VIP with access to an unlimited open bar, an elegant chef prepared dinner, professional photography, a short film viewing, and a comprehensive program celebrating the honorees' achievements.

Honoring Remarkable Achievements. Our honorees are trailblazers beyond the realms of sports, business, organizational, and entertainment. They have established innovative platforms that shatter barriers and create new opportunities for economic freedom. In recognition of their extraordinary achievements, each Juneteenth Awards honoree will receive:

An exclusive recognition letter from the United States Congress. A dedicated statue in their honor at the prestigious Dream Center Economic Freedom Museum.

These individuals embody the principle of "we be what we see," inspiring both current and future generations. Their monumental accomplishments show us that achieving the seemingly impossible is indeed within reach.

Join Us in Celebration. We extend our deepest gratitude to these extraordinary trailblazers for proving that "It's possible!" Join us as we celebrate their contributions at the Juneteenth Legacy Builder Gala, where we will pay tribute to their incredible accomplishments and vision for a brighter future.

Note: This is an exclusive event. You must have a ticket for entry.

Give Back Initiative: For every ticket purchased (**up to the first 200 tickets**), an underserved child will receive a laptop, empowering the next generation with the tools they need for success.

On June 15th from 9:30 to 11:30 a.m., we will be distributing over 200 laptops to underserved youth. Join us for this impactful event! Venue: 6309 Guhn Rd Building B, Houston, TX

The laptops will come preloaded with weekend content designed to positively influence the future of each household.

If you know a family with a child in need, please encourage them to register for a free computer. They will also receive a sponsored ticket to the conference to see their favorite influencers. Registration is on a first-come, first-served basis, and the child must be present to win. Click the registration link for an opportunity:

Youths Registration for free computer: https://airtable.com/appT5XjlOj5R2UUiG/shrrKpmwxE6RDvUNC

Each year, we hold these giveaways. Don‚Äôt miss out‚Äîspread the word!

Let's come together to honor and celebrate those who are paving the way for economic freedom and prosperity within the Black community.
